detection_dist(pos)
plot(fig, offset=0.0)[source]
pt2obst(pos, offset=0.0)[source]

Calculate distance from point to the obstacle

Input
pos: Cardian coordiantes of the point offset: offset distance that will be subtracted from the actual distance pt2obstacle
Output
Real number representing the distance pt2obstacle - offset. Negative value means that the point is closer then the offset value from the obstacle, or even inside it.

class planning_sim.UnicycleKineModel(q_init, q_final, u_init=[0.0, 0.0], u_final=[0.0, 0.0], u_max=[1.0, 5.0], a_max=[2.0, 10.0])[source]

Bases: object [http://docs.python.org/library/functions.html#object]

This class defines the kinematic model of an unicycle mobile robot. Unicycle kinematic model: q’ = f(q, u) [x’, y’, theta’]^T = [v cos(theta), v sin(theta), w]^T

Changing variables (z = [x, y]^T) we rewrite the system as:

|x | |z1 | |y | |z2 | |theta| = |arctan(z2’/z1’) | |v | |sqrt(z1’^2 + z2’^2) | |w | |(z1’z2’’ - z2’z1’‘)/(z1’^2 + z2’^2)|

phi0(q)[source]

Returns z given q

phi1(z)[source]

Returns [x, y, theta]^T given [z dz ddz] (only z and dz are used)

phi2(z)[source]

Returns [v, w]^T given [z dz ddz] (only dz and ddz are used)

phi3(z)[source]
